author: Yantoultra Ngui
title: Malaysia Suspends Opposition Party Ahead of Elections
text:
KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia—A Malaysian agency suspended opposition leader Mahathir Mohamad’s party just before the country’s government is expected to call national elections, potentially bolstering the ruling party’s chances of success in the vote.
The Registrar of Societies, which registers political parties, said Thursday that the party of Malaysia’s long-serving former prime minister didn’t provide enough documents to be properly registered and has been ordered to suspend activities for 30 days. It can’t use its name or logo,...
